question: [File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [YAML vs JSON Mismatch] If the underlying NodeConfig expects JSON but YAML is provided (or vice versa), can this cause silent parsing failures or incorrect config interpretation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Tag Handling] Does the YAML parser properly handle YAML tags (!!str, !!int), and can these be exploited to bypass type checks or inject unexpected value types? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Unbounded Allocation] When creating new Mapping objects at line 19, is there any limit on the number of keys that can be inserted, preventing memory exhaustion from malicious configs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [String Allocation] At lines 143-149, converting large YAML to string could allocate unbounded memory - can this be exploited to cause OOM conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Deep Clone Cost] Recursive cloning of large nested structures could have O(nÂ²) complexity - can this be weaponized for CPU exhaustion attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Buffer Overflow] When reading file contents, are proper bounds checks in place to prevent buffer overflows from maliciously large configuration files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: override_config_mut()] [Privilege Escalation] Can a low-privilege process gain access to override_config_mut to inject admin-level configurations (private key paths, consensus authority) enabling privilege escalation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Key Material Exposure] If NodeConfig contains sensitive key material or secrets, does save_config properly sanitize these before writing to disk, or can it leak validator private keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Malicious Config Injection] Can an attacker with filesystem access replace the config file to inject malicious settings that execute during validator startup before signature verification? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: new_with_default_base()] [Default Validator Keys] Does the default base config contain any default validator keys or credentials that could be exploited if not properly overridden? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Error Message Leakage] At lines 70-75, does the error message leak internal configuration structure, values, or paths that could aid attackers in reconnaissance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Error Propagation] If YAML serialization fails at line 143, does the error propagate safely without exposing configuration content in stack traces or logs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: load_config()] [Partial Load Failure] If NodeConfig::load_config partially succeeds before failing, is the state properly cleaned up to prevent use of incomplete/corrupted configurations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Panic on Conversion] Can serde_yaml::to_value at lines 127-128 panic on certain NodeConfig structures, causing validator crashes during config operations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Type Confusion Attack] Can an attacker provide configs where critical numeric values (ports, timeouts) are encoded as strings, bypassing numeric validation in later processing? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: new()] [Constructor Validation] Does the constructor at lines 92-97 validate that override_config and base_config are compatible/comparable, or can incompatible configs cause panics during diff? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Struct: OverrideNodeConfig] [Invariant Violation] Are there any internal invariants (e.g., base_config must always be default) that can be violated through the public API causing undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [Enum Variant Handling] When comparing enum-typed configs serialized as YAML Mapping, can different variant representations cause false positives/negatives in diff detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: override_config_mut()] [API Endpoint Injection] Can override_config_mut be used to inject malicious API endpoints or RPC URLs that redirect validator traffic to attacker-controlled servers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [P2P Network Hijacking] Can network peer configurations be overridden to isolate validators from the honest network, enabling eclipse attacks or network partition? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [DNS Rebinding] If saved configs contain DNS names for peers/endpoints, can DNS rebinding attacks redirect validators to malicious infrastructure after config load? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: get_yaml()] [Non-deterministic Output] Is the YAML output from get_yaml deterministic across different platforms/runs, or can non-deterministic ordering cause config divergence between validators? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: diff_override_config_yaml()] [HashMap Ordering] Since Mapping iteration order may vary, can this cause different diff results on different validators, breaking consensus on configuration state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Function: save_config()] [Filesystem Encoding] Can filesystem encoding differences (UTF-8 vs UTF-16) cause the same logical config to serialize differently, creating validator configuration inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/config/src/config/override_node_config.rs] [Dependency: serde_yaml] [Upstream Vulnerability] Are there known CVEs in the serde_yaml crate that could be exploited through malicious YAML configs loaded by this module? (Critical)
